quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Team and Mets
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, john, stadium. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When was the first Busch Stadium built?
Jerry Koosman was traded from the Mets to the Twins and in return for Jerry Koosman, the Mets got Jesse Orosco.
What pitcher, who last played with the St. Louis Cardinals, died suddenly in his hotel room in Chicago in 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darryl Kile

questions.question: What year was the St. Louis Cardinals team established?
What team did Ozzie Smith play for before joining the St. Louis Cardinals in 1982?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Diego Padres

questions.question: Who started at third base for the New York Mets on Opening Day in 1962?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Zimmer

questions.question: The New York Mets are the single oldest baseball team team without a no hitter.
What was Bob Gibsons earned run average in 1968?
The New York  Mets lost to which team in the 1988 NLCS?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles Dodgers

questions.question: What former Cardinal played against his old team in the 1985 World Series as a member of the Kansas City Royals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dane Iorg

questions.question: How many years did John Franco spend with the New York Mets?
Which of these baseball players has never played with the New York Mets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fran Healy

questions.question: Which player of the the St. Louis Cardinals set a major league record by hitting two grand slams in a single inning against the Los Angeles Dodgers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fernando Tatis

questions.question: In what year did the St. Louis Cardinals win the World Series after beating the Milwaukee Brewers?
What nickname was applied to the St. Louis Cardinals team of the 1934?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gashouse Gang

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Team and Charger
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, playoffs, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many regular season games did the Chargers win in 2006?
Which former San Diego Charger scored a touchdown against his former team in the Chargers 2006 playoff loss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reche Caldwell

questions.question: Which team did the 2006 Chargers lose to in the playoffs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New England Patriots

questions.question: Wycliffe “Wyc” Grousbeck was the first owner of the Boston Celtics.
Which of the following Charger players did NOT break either the National Football League (NFL) rules or the law in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonio Cromartie

questions.question: Which Charger led the team in receiving touchdowns in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonio Gates

questions.question: Boston Celtics player John Havlicek was elected to the NBA Hall Of Fame in 1983.
Larry Bird wore which Boston Celtics number that was retired February 4, 1993?
How many Chargers were elected to (including replacement player) the 2006 AFC Pro Bowl from the 2006 team?
LaDainian Tomlinson finished first on the 2006 Chargers team in rushing yards. What running back finished second that year behind Tomlinson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Turner

questions.question: Bill Russells uniform number 6 was retired from the Celtics March 12, 1972.
Dennis Johnson, better known as DJ, played how many seasons with the Celtics?
Which of the following is NOT true of Charger running back LaDainian Tomlinson?

options.text: In 2006, he broke the single season scoring record.
In 2006, he won the NFL Most Valuable Player award.
In 2006, he rushed for over 2,000 yards.
In 2006, he became the player to reach 100 touchdowns for a career in the shortest length of time.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In 2006, he rushed for over 2,000 yards.

questions.question: Which member of the 2006 Chargers coaching staff was fired following the season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marty Schottenheimer

questions.question: Which team did the 2006 Chargers shut out on the road on Monday night by the score of 27-0?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oakland Raiders

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Dale Earnhardt Jr. and Number
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, parish, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following tennis players was the World number one player for the most number of consecutive weeks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Federer (Switzerland)

questions.question: Dale Earnhardt Junior owns a share in the Paducah Raceway along with Tony Stewart and what other driver?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ken Schrader

questions.question: During the 1980s decade how many titles did the Celtics win?
The logo of the Boston Celtics is a leprechaun.
Who was the first man to win 8 gold medals at a single Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Phelps (USA, swimming)

questions.question: Besides being co-owner of Chance 2 Motorsports, what other company does Dale Earnhardt  Jr. own?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: JR Motorsports

questions.question: Which cyclist was diagnosed with testicle cancer, but recovered and won the prestigious Tour de France race for a record breaking 7 consecutive years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lance Armstrong (USA)

questions.question: What is the name of Dale Earnhardt Juniors mother?
What is Dale Earnhardt Juniors favourite football team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington Redskins

questions.question: Is Dale Earnhardt Jr. an only child?
The 1985-86 season in the NBA championship saw what number title for the Boston Celtics?
The Celtics were the winners of the NBA title in the 1985-86 season.
What is Dale Earnhardt Juniors full name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ralph Dale Earnhardt, Jr.

questions.question: When was Dale Earnhardt Jr. born?
Robert Parish from the Boston Celtics was better known by his nickname. What was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Chief

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Birth and Athletes
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, drivers, athletes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which team won every competition they could between 2003-2007, including an Olympic Gold, 2 World Championships and 6 World League cups?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brazil, volleyball - men

questions.question: Which Ethiopian is widely considered one of the greatest long distance runners in history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haile Gebrselassie

questions.question: Which of these drivers won the most World Rally Championships and individual rallies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sébastien Loeb (France)

questions.question: NFL running backs Duce Staley and Deuce McAllister are two of a kind, because both of their monikers are actual given names.
Which of the baseball players known as Sparky, has the first and middle name of George Lee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sparky Anderson

questions.question: Which female pole vaulter was first to clear 5m?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yelena Isinbayeva (Russia)

questions.question: Earl and Kultida Woods named their son Tiger when he was born on December 30, 1975 in Cypress, CA. because his birth had been a tough ordeal.
Which fact is true about the two baseball players named Goose?

options.text: Their playing days were separated by some 50 years.
Both their given names are Gander.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their playing days were separated by some 50 years.

questions.question: Bubba was the birth name of how many of these eight athletes: Church, Crosby, Franks, Long, Trammell, Smith, Walton, Wells?
Who won the most Formula 1 Championships in the period 1985-2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Schumacher (Germany)

questions.question: The NFL players Peyton and Archie Manning are the only Manning family men known by their actual birth names.
Which alpine skier is known as Herminator?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herman Maier (Austria)

questions.question: Athletes from which country took all gold medals in table tennis in the Olympic Games in 2000, 2004 and 2008?
Why did baseball player Mordecai Brown get the nickname Three-Finger Brown?

options.text: He was born with just 3 fingers on his pitching hand.
At age 7, his hand was mangled by a corn shredder.
For emphasis, he used to give opponents the finger, in triplicate.
He held up 3 fingers to taunt batters before throwing them 3 straight fastballs.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At age 7, his hand was mangled by a corn shredder.

questions.question: Yankee teammates Bernie Williams and Melky Cabrara were, respectively, born Bernardo and Melchior.

questions.question: Brett Farve has never won a game in Texas Stadium (Home of the Dallas Cowboys) in his career.

options.text: They were born in a huddle.
They are named after Hawaiian snack foods.
They are fraternal, not identical twins.
